msg: Create branch for backport of the fix and associated regression tests

author: dlr
msg: Fix issue #2533 (really this time), making 'svn status -u' show
remotely changed properties on the root of a working copy (now without
pesky double status output for paths at the root of the WC with
This commit reverts portions of r21638.
(close_directory): Store remote prop changes for the root of our
working copy as flag's on the edit baton's anchor_status field,
rather than as status changes of the current directory (which
proved problematic for the algorithms used for status output).
(tweak_statushash): Undo skip of the test for issue #2122 on the

author: wein
msg: Add property handling to mailer.py's commit messages.
It is now possible to also report changes of properties (including
diffs) with a commit message. Therefore several new classes were
added to mailer.py. To configure the reporting of property changes
four new parameters are added to mailer.conf. Without adding these
parameters to an existing configuration file no property changes
show_props              configure which property changes to report
ignore_props            configure which property names shall be ignored
in the list of changed properties
generate_propdiffs      configure for which property changes diffs
ignore_propdiffs        configure which property names shall be ignored
when creating diffs for changed properties
Several appropriate changes to other classes and functions.
New parameters show_props, ignore_props, generate_propdiffs and

author: kfogel
msg: Revert part of r21682 that was never meant to be committed.

author: kfogel
msg: Clarifications, cleanups, and additions to the ra_svn protocol document.
(1. Syntactic structure): Clarify meaning of "optional", and explain
square braces by building on parentheses and question marks.
(4. Extensibility): Underline this section's title, for consistency
with all other top-level section titles.
NOTE: The addition of www/license.html in this revision was
unintentional, and I reverted it in r21683.
